name: lubrication
content:
lubrication noun [U]
(HELPING MOVEMENT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
use of a substance such as oil to make a machine or device operate more easily, or to prevent something sticking or rubbing: Lubrication with gel can help to reduce friction. Supporters say biodiesel fuels aid engine lubrication and cut sulphur emissions.
a substance such as oil that makes a machine or device operate more easily, or prevents something sticking or rubbing: Blades were originally made from flint, while lubrication consisted of animal fat. The mechanics failed to apply enough lubrication during the pump's installation.
lubrication noun [U]
(REMOVING PROBLEMS)
the act of making a process happen easily and without problems: A cut in the discount rate is a little lubrication for the system. People who use platitudes may be displomats, providing social lubrication in the midst of chaos.
lubrication noun [U]
(ALCOHOL)
mainly UK the drinking of alcohol, especially when this makes someone behave in a more open and friendly way: After a bit of lubrication, he can be very indiscreet.
